content.question:
A satellite is orbiting a planet in an elliptical orbit. Five locations in the orbit are <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>, <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>T</mtext></math>, as shown. The distance traveled by the satellite between each point along the path is the same. Which of the following accurately represents the angular momentum about the planet and the kinetic energy of the satellite at the different locations?
Angular momentumKinetic energyA<math alttext="L sub P is greater than L sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
